Notes: It is unclear if Gondi_Sceppabelongs here or is a boroowing.

Additional forms: Also Gondi_Chd caus.huṛsutānāto show; Gondi_Whūṛsahtānāto reveal; Gondi_Ph, Gondi_Wsūrālblind
Notes: The formhupsānāis probably borrowed from Telugu.

Word: ēr (pl. ērk) "(ChD) he, this man, these men"
Notes: The original quality of the vowel has been preserved in Gondi_S (īn<*iv-n) and Gondi_Ch, which alone of all dialects has preserved some traces of-v-in its former position:iyel<*iv-l<*iv-nR. In most other dialects vowel quality has been modified, and some preserved the original-v-by means of a metathese.

Additional forms: Also Gondi_Tr, Gondi_Ph, Gondi_Chd fem.raiyā; Gondi_L fem.leyā; Gondi_Ma fem.leya(pl.-sk); Gondi_Ko fem.lēydaṛ, (T)ledāḍi;Gondi_A (Su.) fem.ḍiyyā; Gondi_A (SR)lehmīyouth
Also Gondi_A (SR)karivāla student;karusānāto teach; Gondi_Chdkarutānā, Gondi_Trkarehtānā, Gondi_Wkarahtānā, Gondi_Phkarrahtānā, Gondi_Mukarih-, Gondi_Makar̨ʔ-to teach
Also Gondi_Mupaŋ, in:paŋ vīnahkthe whole night
Also Gondi_A (SR)perrānāto gather; Gondi_Trpehkānāto pick up; Gondi_Wpahkānāto glean, Gondi_Phpahkānāto choose; Gondi_Mpehkānāto lift, pick; Gondi_S, Gondi_Kopehk-, Gondi_Mapeʔk-to pick up

Also Gondi_Kopermapriest; Gondi_FHpersa pēnhighest god of the Gonds; Gondi_Kopeddalheadman of village; (Su.)pedeyālfather's elder brother; Gondi_Kopers-to grow, grow up; caus.persp-; Gondi_Abers-, Gondi_Mubars-to grow; Gondi_Mpersānāto extend
Also Gondi_Trsārksix each; Gondi_W, Gondi_Phsarne(W) fourth day after tomorrow, (Ph) sixth day
Also Gondi_A (SR)sillenot, no; Gondi_Chdhill-to be not (complete paradigm; SR also gives conjugated forms ofsil/l/-)
